intro: Spigelia queretarensis, commonly known as the Mexican yellowroot, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and showy, orange-red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Its flowers are tubular and attract various pollinators, including bees and hummingbirds. Spigelia queretarensis is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
